column5: WONDERING HOW MUCH SNOW IS IN THE NAKINA AREA? SHOULD THERE BE ENOUGH TO GET THE LAKES UP FROM LAST YEAR?
there is lots of snow this year. much like a normal winter. we are still getting it. its like january still.
From what I have read about Ontario so far, March is the make it or break it month. So hopefully we see plenty of precipitation.
Does anyone know how much snow the Ear Falls area has recieved so far this winter?
The snow is waist deep in most towns... expect very high water this spring.

Thanks for the update, it will be 3 years since my last trip to Goose Bay, and I am bringing a friend to Ontario for his first trip up North! I guess you could say that I have the dreaded fever! I have been to LS at leat half a dozen times, low, normal and high water levels. The fishing has always been good to great!

According to the "Experts" local residents, we definitely will be riding a lot higher in the water column this year, as they have had tons of snow and are looking at April for the all important boost for the season opener with a rainy spring.
